title: about
content:
Award­ winning artist, based between London and Berlin, working at the intersections of fine arts, sculpture and design. Specialised in synthetic polymers (resin, rubber), and metal.

 

After receiving an international MA scholarship from University of Arts, London in 2010 for the prestigious MA Artefact course, Ana won the LCF Best Design Award 2012 and the  Project of the Year Award at ITS (International Talent Support) 2012 in Italy for her “ANIMAL: The Other Side of Evolution” project.
Exhibited internationally in London, Paris, New York, Rome, Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Berlin, Vienna,  etc., in such museums and galleries as the Louvre (FR), Centre Pompidou (FR), Smithsonian Design Museum (NYC), Boijmans Museum (NL) among others.
In 2013 Ana got SEED Award (London) for Exceptional Talents. In 2014 she was nominated from British Global Awards for the Artist of the Year Award, and in 2015 for the Outstanding Creation & Invention Prize at Biennale International de Design, Saint Etienne.

 

An architecture graduate, she has also stepped in the areas of film, with her own co­produced fashion film Encounters, screened at Rotterdam International Film Festival (2011) and Berlin Fashion Week (2010).

 

Her work has been featured in major print and online publications such as The Independent, Guardian, CNN, British Vogue, Vogue NL, Vogue IT, Dazed and Confused, Interview Magazine, Marie Claire France, Another Magazine, Stylus, Core77, Dezeen,  among others.

In 2012 Independent listed her as one of the 12 most promising artists from the University of The Arts, London.

 

Ana is regularly invited as a public speaker on future of design and new technologies. Since 2013 She has also been a visiting professional / critic at AA Architecture Association in London, and London College of Fashion, UK. Ana also runs a Fashion Artefact workshop at IED Istituto Europeo di Design in Madrid, ES.

 

Contributing artist at SHOWstudio, London, as well as RSA (Royal Society of Arts) member.
